Rather than using `'all'` to fight defaults, why not have these APIs always include everything by default and use the presence and value of `enumerable` et al to control behavior, much like `defineProperty` (which ignores missing attributes as long as the property already exists).
content.formatted_body: Rather than using 'all' to fight defaults, why not have these APIs always include everything by default and use the presence and value of enumerable et al to control behavior, much like defineProperty (which ignores missing attributes as long as the property already exists).
